document_data.caption: A map showing the Desert Mosque in the northern High Desert.
document_data.name: Desert Mosque
document_data.mainbody: The '''Desert Mosque''', also called the '''Oasis of the Desert Mosque''', was a religious structure in [[Zakhara]] where [[Haku]], the Zakharan god of freedom, was worshiped.{{cite book/Land of Fate/Fortunes and Fates|29}}
document_data.Location: The Desert Mosque was located about halfway between the [[Pit of the Ghuls]] and the [[Zakharan seas|Sea of Caravans]] in the northern reaches of the [[High Desert]].
document_data.Description: The Desert Mosque was a massive dome constructed of volcanic rock. It was mostly buried in the sand but faced [[Huzuz]], the City of Delights.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38">
document_data.Activities: The [[Dome Dancers]] worshiped Haku at this mosque.
document_data.History: The location of the Desert Mosque was the site where the first desert dweller, [[Yusef al-Nasr]], received [[Zakharan pantheon|enlightenment]].<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38"/>
document_data.Inhabitants: The Desert Mosque was run by a man named [[Angaloran]].
document_data.Defenses: A different clan from the [[House of Nasr]] protected the Mosque for a year at a time.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p38"/>
